title: Engineer-y Typeface
content: Hey all. I have been commissioned to do a project that is totally not up my alley--design a logo and identity for an engineering firm called Meta Engineering. I am trying to make some type choices and have a few ideas...if I purchase a new typeface I don't want to spend a lot so does anyone have suggestions for a cheap Engineer-ish typeface?
author: julia.warren

comments.content: _Meta_ Engineering - are you serious? Sorry to state the obvious, but you should use... Myriad.
Haha...are you serious? I mean, I love the myriad/meta connection but...boring?

DIN would be obvious.  
More subtle would be Klavika, or Cachet.

hhp

[Isocteur](http://web.archive.org/web/20150123175807/http:/www.ltu.se/polopoly_fs/1.30869!isocteur%20(truetype)%20.pdf). it's an old AutoCAD font.

Nothing says "engieering" like AuroCAD.

Can be effective in small doses

-=®=-

Interesting that everyone except F. Frank went sans serif on this one. I'd lean towards something like Adrian Frutiger's [Serifa](http://web.archive.org/web/20150123175807/http:/www.fonts.com/FindFonts/Detail.htm?pid=242570&/cgi-bin/MsmGo.exe?grab_id=0&page_id=50481&query=SERIFA&SCOPE=Fonts).
Thanks for all of the suggestions. I love this site and all you typophiles.

I'm just pulling inspiration from Design Observer: [http://do3.rubystudio.com/archives/entry.html?id=25212](http://web.archive.org/web/20150123175807/http:/do3.rubystudio.com/archives/entry.html?id=25212 "http://do3.rubystudio.com/archives/entry.html?id=25212")
